data.title: Not Number One on TripAdvisor!
data.text: Not sure about the number one ranking. We had a Sunday brunch here and the wait was as promised at about 30 minutes. Servers were friendly and good. I would consider this a hole in the wall type place with crowded conditions and not much atmosphere. I had a the special jerk pork with an overwhelming chipotle flavor. I was disappointed but should have ordered some scrambled eggs. Their biscuits are as big as a loaf of bread and quite good. There is a homemade raspberry jam on table too. The coffee is hot but not great. My wife and daughter had the salmon cakes Benedict. My daughter said they were fishy but my wife loved them. I probably would not seek out this place the next time in Athens

data.title: The Autumn Hash was Outstanding
data.text: An Athens icon, Mama's Boy lived up to its reputation. Long lines make it imperative that you get there before the students wake up on the weekends!

data.title: It was ok
data.text: The food was good. Everything was fresh and the waitress was nice. I originally rated this spot as a "will come back" until I saw the low "B" health score. I won't be back.

data.title: breakfast
data.text: I stopped to have breakfast before leaving town....yum!  The food was fantastic and the service fast and friendly....their biscuits rock.

data.title: Great brunch
data.text: We had a large group for brunch yesterday. The food was great. The biscuits were amazing. This was our first visit but next time we are in Athens we will return.

data.title: Great salad special
data.text: First time visit and found a great chicken arrugula salad special. Serving breakfast plates at noon time.

data.title: Breakfast before a college tour
data.text:
We chose Mama's Boy as it was on a list of best breakfast eateries in Athens.  I had read how busy it typically was so we were glad to get a table as we walked in.  We ordered the breakfast pork taco, the breakfast scrambler, a cinnamon roll to share and juice/coffee.  Our waitress was very pleasant and we placed our order.  The cinnamon roll was as large as your face! and absolutely delicious.  Coffee was pretty good, but it was a very distinctive flavor that wasn't my favorite.  The pork breakfast taco was excellent and my scrambler was ok, but after eating my day's worth of carbs with a portion of the cinnamon roll I didn't enjoy the biscuit or grits like I should have.  
If you're on a low carb diet, this probably isn't the restaurant for you.  When we left it they had a line of people waiting for tables.  
I would definitely return.

data.title: 5 stars, Delish !!
data.text: Amazing breakfast!  We got the pork tacos and Veggie Hash. We loved the food and excellent costumer service by Ryan (waiter). Can't wait to be back !

data.title: Quirky southern diner
data.text: My family had breakfast here when visiting UGA. Food was good. Biscuits were outstanding. It took awhile for breakfast to arrive after we ordered but our waiter checked in regularly and was very friendly. Parking was definitely a challenge, even on a Monday morning. We had to park a few blocks away on a side road, but it was a pleasant walk and felt good after eating such a filling breakfast.

data.title: Awesome Breakfast
data.text: Small local place with excellent food and friendly service.  We went for breakfast early was seated quickly and had a very friendly server.  I had a bacon and egg scrambler with grits and  a huge delicious biscuit.   It was fantastic and I will be back.

data.title: OMG....a Southern Breakfast to Remember!
data.text: I'm not really a breakfast person,but my oldest daughter who is a student at UGA insisted that our family eat at Mama's Boy.  And what a breakfast it was!   We ordered a few plates to share including southern favorites such as biscuits(a mile high) & gravy, the peach-filled french toast, and a scrambled plate.  All was delicious and very filling.  If you have a hankering for some Southern comfort breakfast food and want to eat where the locals do, then head for Mama's Boy.

data.title: Fuel for the day
data.text: Stopped here for breakfast on a visit to Athens.  Reviews were great so thought we would start our day here.  Neat little southern breakfast place that also serves lunch.  Parking is tight so I recommend starting early.  Lots of students getting breakfast.  Coffee was standard diner coffee which I enjoy.  Don't expect Starbucks and you will be fine.  Two of us ordered the bacon-cheese egg scramble plate, one had the standard country breakfast plate and the last had a half order of the peach French toast and a fried chicken biscuit.  The biscuits are true "cathead" country biscuits.  One would be enough for breakfast.  Slightly crusty buttered outside and tender slightly salty fluffy interior.  Just like grandma in Mississippi would make.  My cheese grits were some of the best I have had.  Creamy and flavorful, the cheese was sprinkled on top.  They could have had a little more cheese or incorporated the cheese when cooking, but that is only a minor issue.  Egg scramble was just ok, mostly because I could not taste the cheese.  The peach French toast and fried chicken biscuit disappeared quickly by someone who rarely eats a cracker for breakfast, so both of those would be rated "scrumptious".  Our server was slow but others seemed quick and competent.  Average ticket with tip and drink was $15.  Definitely worth a stop for a great country breakfast from someone who learned how to cook well from his mama.

data.title: Great Southern cooking
data.text: We were there for breakfast.  The food was very good with large portions. Our waiter was helpful in making recommendations and the service was fast.

data.title: Great Southern Good
data.text: Biscuits are just like my grandmother used to make, light, buttery and fluffy. The thick slice bacon could be meal itself. They serve strong Jittery Joe's coffee, which we like.We went during the week, it was full but there was no wait to be seated. Service was great!

data.title: Amazing breakfast and lunch
data.text: Good old fashioned Southern Food tastes in a great Athens quirky, cool atmosphere. Food is delicious and the word is out so get there early as the line can often be well outside the door.

data.title: Fantastic food!
data.text: We stopped here on our way in for a campus tour at UGA, and we were not disappointed!  Food was unreal and portions were more than generous.  Be sure to get the Cinnamon Bun...it was heavenly!

data.title: Always a great spot
data.text: Found this place a couple years ago - sure glad we did. We made a reservation months in advance (you will be glad you did, especially on any Sunday, and ANY game day weekend). This place FILLS up quickly (breakfast/brunch). But they turn the tables pretty quickly. Service was fine, but they are so busy. Coffee is great! Love the feel to the place. FOOD! What more can I say, its fresh, local and amazing. Love every bite. Ask for the special. And just get it. You won't regret it... unless you don't make a reservation on a busy day. Also, plan ahead for parking!!!!!

data.title: Great food - Great Fun - Highly recommend!
data.text: Atmosphere makes this a must stop in Athens - actually if you're driving in GA set your GPS to Mama's Boy and enjoy! Great flavor in every bite we had - where do you get such fresh food? Awesome. The staff was amazing and we felt like we've were neighbors who had been coming for years. The place has the right amount of quirky and taste - I've read that there may be lines, but we were seated in 5 minutes, served immediately and enjoyed immensely!

data.title: Great breakfast!
data.text: We had a platter of eggs w/bacon, grits, and a biscuit in addition to a chicken biscuit and a cinnamon roll. The cinnamon roll was HUGE and delicious. The chicken biscuit was 1,000x better than Chick-fil-A. We arrived around 9:30 am on a Saturday (non-game-day) morning and only had to wait 10 minutes (after being told 20-25 min.). What a wonderful experience! Great staff as well.

data.title: Worth the wait
data.text: The like out the door is an obvious indication the food is good. We waited about 40 minutes on a Sunday and I would wait again! The tofu dish was so good. The scrambles were great. Biscuits were huge and so fluffy. Loved the idea of chocolate cake for breakfast. One of my favorites but have to go back to try it. Highly recommend this place. Was a local place too. Everyone knew each other. And was friendly.
